comments:
Hi,

We have created an application as the eclipse plugin. And created the seperated installer, which includes required eclipse plugin jar files.
But on starting my application, I am getting the following poup message:

      Application command execution "{EXE_file}"  failed ! Exitcode

Also find the errorlog details below:

!SESSION 2006-09-05 19:23:17.547 -----------------------------------------------
eclipse.buildId=M200409161125
java.version=1.5.0
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -data {MyProject_Destination_folder}

!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi 2006-09-05 19:23:17.953
!MESSAGE Application error
!STACK 1
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Unable to acquire application service.
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:367)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:163)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:334)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:278)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:973)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:948)


Thanks and Regards,
Braj Kishore
Could you provide a command line you use to launch Eclipse (or eclipse.ini if you use it) and the description of the application extension point from the plugin.xml?

Hi,

Thanks for your reply.
Please find the steps, I am using to execute our application:
Step 1: Build the application.
Step 2: Create the exe file, for the plugin application. This application contains only depdendent eclipse 3.1.2 plugin and features jar files.
Step 3: Install the application. This does not contain eclipse.ini, only startup.jar at the parent folder.
Step 4: Start the application. This is creating the problem, which I mentioned you earlier. I even checked the plugin.xml file, we are creating at our side.

NOTE: Using the same steps on Eclipse 3.0 and using eclipse 3.0 plugin and feature jar file is working fine. Also, testing from inside the eclipse 3.1.2 environment is working fine. To create the executable application, I added all those jar files, which are avilable in Eclipse 3.1 runtime environment to run our application.

Thanks and Regards,
Braj Kishore

Thanks and Regards,
Braj Kishore

OK, now I am confused :-). Your application: is it an RCP application or is it a standalone Java application? 

If it is an RCP application, you need to: 1) define an application extension  in the plugin.xml, and 2) specify somehow (in the config.ini, or in the command line, or some other way) the application to be launched. That's why I asked to see how you launch it and the contents of the plugin.xml.

If is is a standalone Java application where you use parts of Eclipse as a library, that is a totally different story.

Are you sure that you are using eclipse 3.1.2?
The build id indicates: M200409161125 which precedes eclipse 3.1.

I found the solution for this.
In fact, with Eclipse 3.0 plugin jar files, following property of commented in config.ini file
osgi.bundles=org.eclipse.core.runtime@2:start, org.eclipse.update.configurator@3:start

But, I found that with eclipse 3.1.2 plugin jar files, I need to uncomment the above property in config.ini file
